Hi Sriram,

In order to get the info you want, you have to turn on INFO log=
ging for the MirrorWriterProcessor.  

Add the following line to $HERITRIX_=
HOME/conf/logging.properties:

org.archive.modules.writer.MirrorWriterProce=
ssor.level =3D INFO

After you do that and restart Heritrix, you'll get the=
 info you want in $HERITRIX_HOME/heritrix_out.log, e.g.:

2010-01-01 01:01:=
01.001 INFO thread-1 org.archive.modules.writer.MirrorWriterProcessor.inner=
Process() http://example.org/robots.txt -> ./mirror/example.org/robots.txt
=

Steve

On 01/07/2010 at 1:21 PM, sriram_varahan1 wrote:
> 
> 
> Thanks for=
 the reply.
> 
> I need the file names along with the path that are generat=
ed for each
> url. For example: For an URL: http://abc.com/a.html
> <http:/=
/abc.com/a.html> it is stored as
> $HERITRIX_HOME/mirror/abc.com/a.html Is =
there a place from where I can
> get this mapping for every URL as: http://=
abc.com/a.html
> <http://abc.com/a.html>  -> $HERITRIX_HOME/mirror/abc.com/=
a.html
> 
> On going through the source code I found that it is being logge=
d using
> the logger.
> But not sure where to look for it.
> 
> Thanks,
> S=
riram Varahan.
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> <mailto:archiv=
e-crawler%40yahoogroups.com> , Steven A Rowe <sarowe@...>
> wrote:

 I have found, actually, that the H3 MirrorWriterProcessor writes to

ITRIX_HOME/mirror/, rather than to

or/, as I too would expect. Seems
> like a bug to me.
> > 
> > I work aroun=
d this problem using the following property setting under
> > the MirrorWri=
terProcessor bean:

> > <property name=3D"path" value=3D"jobs/your_job_=
name/mirror"/>
> > 
> > That means I have to customize it for every job, bu=
t it's not that much
> > hassle.
> > 
> > Steve
